name: Grilled Shrimp, Pea Shoot, and Bok Choy Salad with Asian Reduced Fat Dressing
author: Karen Barris Calabro
summary: This is the tastiest shrimp salad without any guilt: only a trace of oil makes it perfect for serving any dieter. If you want to feel healthy, but enjoy your food, this is the salad for you. You may want to garnish with additional green onions and chopped peanuts, but I find that placing the shrimp on the top is garnish enough.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons lime juice, or more to taste
½ teaspoon salt, or more to taste
1 pound jumbo shrimp, peeled and deveined
directions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Place grapes in a food processor or blender; process until pureed
Whisk pureed grapes, fish sauce, lime juice, garlic, chile sauce, and salt together in a bowl until dressing is well combined
Spoon about 2 tablespoons dressing and oil into a bowl; add shrimp
Reserve remaining dressing for the salad
Refrigerate shrimp until chilled and marinated, 15 to 20 minutes
Place eggplant in a roasting pan and spray with enough cooking spray to coat
Roast eggplant in the preheated oven until browned, about 15 minutes
Transfer eggplant to the reserved dressing
Preheat an outdoor grill for high heat and lightly oil the grate
Remove shrimp from marinade and discard marinade
Cook shrimp on the hot grill until visibly pink on the bottom, about 3 minutes
Flip shrimp and cook until cooked through but not dry, 4 to 5 minutes
Remove shrimp from grill and allow to rest
Combine bok choy, pea shoots, carrots, cucumbers, mint, cilantro, peanuts, and green onions in a large bowl; add eggplant with dressing and shrimp and toss well
